text: Lionnel Luca (born December 19, 1954 in Boulogne-Billancourt) was a member of the National Assembly of France. Of Romanian origin, he represented the Alpes- Maritimes department from 1997 to 2017, as a member of the Union for a Popular Movement. ==References== ==External links== * Official website * Profile at the National Assembly Category:1954 births Category:Living people Category:People from Boulogne-Billancourt Category:French people of Romanian descent Category:Rally for the Republic politicians Category:Union for a Popular Movement politicians Category:The Republicans (France) politicians Category:Gaullism, a way forward for France Category:The Popular Right Category:Debout la France politicians Category:Tibet freedom activists Category:Deputies of the 11th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:Deputies of the 12th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:Deputies of the 13th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:Deputies of the 14th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:Mayors of places in Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur Category:University of Nice alumni
title: Lionnel Luca
